===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=さかば|酒|tr1=saka|t1=alcohol|pos1=the older combining form of the standalone reading ''sake''|場|tr2=ba|t2=place|pos2=from older {{IPAchar|/nipa/}} “place”, from which also modern {{m|ja|庭}} ''niwa''}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|さかば|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=3|acc2_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|さかば}}

# a [[bar]], a [[saloon]], a [[pub]]

====Synonyms====
* {{ja-r|バー}}: a [[bar]] {{qualifier|generally more modern and western in style}}
* {{ja-r|居酒屋|いざかや}}: a Japanese [[pub]] {{qualifier|often, but not necessarily, more traditionally Japanese in style}}
* {{ja-r|飲み屋|のみや}}: a smaller drinking establishment {{qualifier|generally smaller and less expensive}}
* {{ja-r|スナック}}: a [[snack]] [[bar]] {{qualifier|usually smaller, with light food available, and often with an emphasis on chatting with the female staff}}
